li.a: Message from the Superintendent: A-F Rating System
G-P Gives for Kids | Annual Campaign
Message from the Superintendent: A-F Rating System
G-P Gives for Kids | Annual Campaign

strong.u: G-PISD extends Modified Operations following State Closure of Schools for the Remainder of the School Year

div.p: Dear G-P Community,

p.strong: Today Governor of Texas, Greg Abbott, announced an executive order to extend the closure of all Texas schools through the remainder of this school year, 2019-20. In response Gregory-Portland ISD will continue to run with modified operations, and continue e-learning for students, through the last scheduled day of school on Thursday, May 21st.

div.p: For the remainder of this school year, G-PISD campuses and facilities will remain closed to the public. This includes all UIL events, practices, rehearsals, and all other programs and activities involving students that require gathering in person. G-PISD teachers and staff will continue to receive direction from supervisors, and we will continue to perform the essential work of educating and serving our students and families at a distance via e-learning. Additionally, we will develop a process and communicate with families so that any school district materials or equipment being borrowed by students may be returned to G-PISD in a safe manner. We would also like to remind you that resources are available for students and families who may be experiencing difficulties at home. We encourage you to reach out to our District and Campus Administrators, including Counselors and Social Workers, via Anonymous Alerts or at g-pisd.org/ContactUs. You can also find resources for counseling, meals, financial assistance, and more, at g-pisd.org/SupportServices.

District updates will continue to be provided via standard notification systems and social platforms (email, phone, Remind, website, Facebook, Twitter). The latest information from the District, and tips for preventing illness as well as identifying the symptoms of COVID-19, can be found at www.g-pisd.org/COVID-19.

We are thankful for the ability to continue serving our students and families during this time. However, we also acknowledge the sacrifices necessary to do so. As always, our students are our greatest concern. We are saddened for all of them, because we realize how many are missing the environment, structure, social interactions, and friendships they have enjoyed this year. We are deeply disappointed that this pandemic has resulted in missed time and celebrations for our graduating seniors, and we will be developing plans to address their needs as much as we can. More will be communicated to the parents of graduating seniors regarding graduation plans, and any other plans to support our Class of 2020.

We extend our sincerest thanks, once again, to all of our parents and guardians who are balancing needs at home to make continued e-learning possible for all students. We are grateful for all of our teachers and staff whose classrooms remain empty, and whose hearts remain full. Together, we will get through this experience and move forward as one community.

In all my time as Superintendent of this school district, I have consistently seen so many of you come together time and time again to help each other. The G-P community is strong because of you, and because of the students being raised and educated here. They will remember this time, and they will remember that we did our best for them. I assure you we will continue to do our part for each and every student, and I know you will continue to do the same. For this, and for everything else you are doing to serve this community, I sincerely thank you.
Respectfully,
Dr. Paul Clore, Superintendent
Gregory-Portland ISD

a.data-page-name: G-PISD extiende operaciones modificadas luego del cierre estatal de escuelas por el resto del año escolar

h2.a: Haga clic aquí para ver en español.

strong.u: THIRD G-PISD EMPLOYEE TESTS POSITIVE FOR COVID-19

div.p: Gregory-Portland ISD administration has been notified that a third employee tested positive for COVID-19. This employee was the last of three who reported symptoms and had been working at G-P Middle School. The employee has not been at work for the last 14 days. This report confirms that all three employees who reported symptoms, and had been working at G-P Middle School between March 18-20, 2020, have now tested positive for the virus.

The District notified the San Patricio County Health Department to report this information immediately upon receipt. All G-PISD campuses and facilities have been closed since Friday, March 27, 2020. Actions were promptly taken after the District received reports from these employees that they were experiencing symptoms.

The District will protect the privacy of these employees, and will not be able to provide further information. However, we do extend our sincere support and wish all three of these employees a full recovery.

We ask our employees, and all in our community, to continue to be diligent in practicing social distancing and staying at home as much as possible (with some exceptions for those required to work outside the home). If you reside in a city or county where a "stay at home" order has been issued, please abide by the order. Additionally, please continue to monitor yourself and those in your family for any signs of illness (fever, cough, or shortness of breath), and plan to stay home from work and any other activities if you are not feeling well. As reported by local medical officials and authorities, these practices will aid in preventing the spread of COVID-19.
Information about how to prevent illness, tips for recognizing the signs and symptoms of COVID-19, and links to local and national medical resources are available at: g-pisd.org/COVID-19
Thank you - G-PISD Administration

a.data-page-name: Tercer empleado de G-PISD prueba positivo para COVID-19

h2.a: Haga clic aquí para ver en español.

span.u: G-PISD Extends Modified Operations following State Closure of Schools until May 4th

div.p: Dear G-P Community,

div.strong: Yesterday, Governor of Texas Greg Abbott announced an executive order to extend the closure of all Texas schools through Monday, May 4th. In response, Gregory-Portland ISD will continue to run with modified operations through Friday, May 1st. Normal operations will resume with students returning to classrooms
(and teachers/staff returning the day prior on

div.div: All G-PISD campuses and facilities will remain closed to the public, and to staff, until that time. This includes all UIL events, practices, rehearsals, and all other programs and activities involving students that require gathering in person. G-PISD teachers and staff will continue to receive direction from supervisors, and we will continue to perform the essential work of educating and serving our students and families at a distance via e-learning.

District updates will continue to be provided via standard notification systems and social platforms (email, phone, Remind, website, Facebook, Twitter). The latest information from the District, and tips for preventing illness as well as identifying the symptoms of COVID-19, can be found at www.g-pisd.org/COVID-19

We understand this is a unique and challenging time for everyone. Whether you are a parent or guardian at home helping students, a teacher continuing to provide instruction online, a G-PISD team member continuing to perform your duties in service to our families, an administrator balancing a host of decisions and tasks, a community member supporting our school district in any way you can, or a School Board member extending us your support and leadership: I cannot thank you enough for all that you are doing in service to every one of our students.

I assure you that I will continue to do my best to serve you, and I know our team at G-PISD will do the same. Thank you for the honor of serving you and your family through the work we do as educators and public servants during this unprecedented time. Thank you, also, for your continued support of our school district and your diligence in doing your part to keep everyone in our community as safe and healthy as possible. Let's use this time to stay home, stay well, and stay focused on what matters most: Our students, and the great need to protect everyone in our community.
Respectfully,
Dr. Paul Clore, Superintendent
Gregory-Portland ISD

a.data-page-name: G-PISD extiende operaciones modificadas luego del cierre estatal de escuelas hasta el 4 de mayo

h2.a: Haga clic aquí para ver en español.

div.p: Gregory-Portland ISD administration has been notified that a second employee has tested positive for COVID-19. This employee was one of three who reported symptoms last week, and had been working at G-P Middle School between March 18-20, 2020. This report confirms that two of these three employees have now tested positive for the virus.

The District notified the San Patricio County Health Department to report this information immediately upon receipt. All G-PISD campuses and facilities have been closed since Friday, March 27, 2020. Actions were promptly taken after the District received reports from these employees that they were experiencing symptoms.

The District will protect the privacy of these employees, and will not be able to provide further information. However, we do extend our sincere support and wish both of these employees a full recovery. We also extend the same to the third employee who has reported similar symptoms, but who has not reported any test results as of this time.

We ask our employees, and all in our community, to continue to be diligent in practicing social distancing and staying at home as much as possible (with some exceptions for those required to work outside the home). If you reside in a city or county where a "stay at home" order has been issued, please abide by the order. Additionally, please continue to monitor yourself and those in your family for any signs of illness (fever, cough, or shortness of breath), and plan to stay home from work and any other activities if you are not feeling well. As reported by local medical officials and authorities, these practices will aid in preventing the spread of COVID-19.
Thank you - G-PISD Administration

a.data-page-name: G-PISD empleado prueba positiva para COVID-19

h2.a: Haga clic aquí para ver en español.

div.p: Gregory-Portland ISD administration has been notified that one employee has tested positive for COVID-19. This employee was one of three who reported symptoms this week, and had been working at G-P Middle School between March 18-20, 2020.

G-PISD notified the San Patricio County Health Department to report this information immediately upon receipt. Yesterday, the District closed the G-P Middle School campus to staff after this employee, and the two other employees, reported symptoms that were synonymous with possible infection of the virus. All other campuses and facilities were also closed to staff at 4 p.m. yesterday as a precautionary measure.

The District will protect the privacy of this employee, and will not be able to provide further information. However, we do extend our sincere support and wish this employee a full recovery. We also extend the same to the two employees who have reported similar symptoms, but who have not reported any test results as of this time.

We ask our employees, and all in our community, to continue to be diligent in practicing social distancing and staying at home as much as possible (with some exceptions for those required to work outside the home). If you reside in a city or county where a "stay at home" order has been issued, please abide by the order. Additionally, please continue to monitor yourself and those in your family for any signs of illness (fever, cough, or shortness of breath), and plan to stay home from work and any other activities if you are not feeling well. As reported by local medical officials and authorities, these practices will aid in preventing the spread of COVID-19.
Thank you,
G-PISD Administration

a.data-page-name: G-PISD empleado prueba positiva para COVID-19

h2.a: Haga clic aquí para ver en español.

strong.span: G-PISD Closes all Campuses to Staff at 4 p.m. Today | Friday, March 27, 2020

div.strong: Effective at 4 p.m. today, Friday, March 27, 2020, Gregory-Portland ISD will close all campuses, offices, and facilities

Some employees will continue to work on site as requested and advised by their supervisors, and only with permission from District and Campus Administrators (Principals, Directors, and/or Leadership Cabinet members). Safety measures will continue to be implemented for any staff working on site to continue serving the needs of our District, and the needs of our students and families.

div.div: G-PISD facilities will not be accessed at will by any employees without this express permission, and access to G-P Middle School by any employee will still require the permission of the Superintendent until further notice as previously communicated this morning.

This action is being taken out of an abundance of caution following the closure of G-P Middle School earlier today due to reports of three employees at that campus experiencing some symptoms of COVID-19, as well as awareness of 'stay at home' orders being released by various cities and counties where some of our employees reside. These 'stay at home' orders should not inhibit essential personnel (those called on site by supervisors/administrators) from working as directed.

Employees working from home, or who need to access campuses, offices, and facilities for any reason, must do so this afternoon before 4 p.m. Plans are in place to continue services for students and families including, but not limited to, free meals and e-learning from home. More information will be communicated as soon as possible regarding any potential changes or adjustments to these processes.

We thank all of our employees for their continued service to our students, parents, and community, and we thank those in our community for their continued support of our school district. Additionally, we will be checking in with the employees who have reported symptoms from G-P Middle School, and we wish them improved health and recovery from the symptoms they have reported.
Thank you,
G-PISD Administration

a.data-page-name: G-PISD Cerrando todos los campus al personal a las 4 p.m. Hoy viernes 27 de marzo de 2020

h2.a: Haga clic aquí para ver en español.

strong.span: G-P Middle School Closed to Staff until Further Notice

div.p: Gregory-Portland ISD has been notified that three (3) District employees have exhibited some of the symptoms of COVID-19. These three individuals reported having been near one another simultaneously while on campus, and of the three, only one (1) qualified to be tested for COVID-19 (results are currently pending). Out of respect for the privacy of the employee(s), the District is not able to provide additional information. However, please be assured that the District is cooperating with the San Patricio County Health Department and is assisting in identifying any other individuals who may have come into contact with this/these individual(s) in recent days.

The District believes that these employees were at G-P Middle School between March 18-20, 2020.We encourage any individuals who were present at this location on those dates to take necessary precautions for their health and safety of themselves and their family. Please also be advised that G-PISD staff has been actively working to keep all areas at campuses and facilities as clean as possible, with heightened procedures in recent weeks for disinfection as a precautionary measure for all employees.

p.strong: As a result of the latest information, G-PISD will
the G-P Middle School campus to all staff until further notice. No one is to enter the building for any reason until, or unless, expressly advised and approved by the Superintendent.

a.data-page-name: La escuela secundaria G-P está cerrada al personal hasta nuevo aviso

h2.a: Haga clic aquí para ver en español.

div.p: Dear G-P Community,
div.div: Gregory-Portland ISD will run with modified operations beginning Monday, March 23rd, 2020. The District plans to resume normal operations with students returning to classrooms on Tuesday, April 14th (and teachers/staff returning the day prior on Monday, April 13th). Earlier today the Governor of Texas, Greg Abbott, held a press conference and announced an executive order that included, as quoted: "All schools in the State of Texas shall be temporarily closed, but this does not mean education stops; instead, Superintendents should continue to work with the Texas Education Agency (TEA) to continue online or additional educational options."

This order at the state level not only solidified G-PISD's current plan of action, but also confirmed that it is aligned with requirements now set forth by the state. In the last several days we have received insight and guidance from local and state health officials, TEA, and other state authorities. We have collaborated with Superintendents across our region and county as well as the Education Service Center-Region 2 to strategically plan for the ability to continue serving our students despite the challenges we are facing today.

During modified operations, all G-PISD campuses and facilities will be closed to the public. This includes all UIL events, practices, rehearsals, and all other programs and activities involving students that require gathering in person. G-PISD teachers and staff will receive direction from supervisors, whether working from home or on site as needed, to continue performing the essential work of educating and serving our students and families.

G-PISD administrators and teachers are currently working to provide distance learning at home for students, including both virtual resources and printed instructional materials where necessary. Families will receive information from campuses and teachers via current communication platforms as this process begins. We will need support from our parents to provide an environment for learning at home that will ensure academic growth continues for every student, and we understand this may create some challenges for families. While we look forward to resuming the normal school day and educating our students in person, we extend our sincere thanks to those at home who will be working with us to make learning happen at a distance.

In addition to the need for continued academic growth, distance learning also helps provide students with as much daily structure and normalcy as possible during a time that may be difficult for them to understand. As we address concerns related to physical health, it is important to maintain awareness of mental health and find ways to ease any anxiety or concerns for students. Please visit our website for information about this topic, as well as resources available for students who may have significant difficulty coping with changes during this time. As a reminder, any student or parent can also reach out to us via the Anonymous Alerts app or online submission page. To further support student needs, we will also continue providing free curbside breakfast and lunch meals. For the latest information about free meals, please visit our website.

As we transition to modified operations, we will continue to keep you informed. District communication updates will continue to be provided via standard notification systems and social platforms (email, phone, Remind, website, Facebook, Twitter). At any time, the latest information from the District as well as reminders for staying well and preventing illness can be found at g-pisd.org/COVID-19.

Thank you for the constant privilege of serving you and your family through the work we do as educators and public servants during this unprecedented time. We will continue to perform that work in the weeks to come, thanks to your support. In the meantime, we believe our collective and proactive response to COVID-19 will be an important step in the right direction for the good of others, and for the good of our students. Together, we can all do our part to keep everyone in our community as safe and healthy as possible.
Respectfully,
Dr. Paul Clore, Superintendent
Gregory-Portland ISD

h2.a: Haga clic aquí para ver en español.

div.div:
Dear G-PISD Parents/Guardians, Staff, and Community,
Thank you for the support you've provided in recent days and weeks, both within our campuses and in your homes, to encourage and employ best practices for preventing illness. We understand from local and national medical authorities that everyone, working together, will need to diligently continue this effort to minimize the spread of COVID-19 ("Coronavirus") and help protect those most vulnerable among us.
With that goal in mind, and considering information received from various state and local authorities (including receipt of an update from the Texas Education Agency for school districts regarding COVID-19 released last night), Gregory-Portland ISD will extend Spring Break for an additional week with no school and no extracurricular activities until Monday, March 23, 2020. All G-PISD teachers and staff are asked to remain in the local area, and anticipate further direction from supervisors.
This decision was not made lightly, and we understand the change may cause an inconvenience for some families. While no cases of COVID-19 have been confirmed in our county as of this date/time, we are taking this proactive approach out of an abundance of caution and concern for our community. However, please keep in mind that the Texas Education Code (TEC) requires school districts to provide 75,600 minutes of instruction to students during the school year. As of this time, there have been no confirmed changes to this requirement for districts in our situation (with no confirmed cases of COVID-19). This extended Spring Break (March 16-20) will not require additional minutes or days to the current schedule. If future action is needed to close for additional days, we will be planning steps to add minutes to our operational day as necessary. We will continue to closely monitor this situation, and keep you informed of any changes.
Preventing & Reporting Illness
We hope to receive your continued support as we try to do our part to minimize public interactions and therefore lessen the potential spread of this illness. We also ask that you please consider joining us in following guidelines from medical officials to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 by avoiding large crowds, electing to avoid or limit travel plans, and continuing to follow best practices for preventing illness. Please see the list of reminders below:
Practice excellent handwashing procedures, and encourage students to do the same (minimum 20-second scrub with soap all over hands and forearms, every time);
Encourage students to wash hands before every meal, and remind younger students not to place hands (or toys, pencils, etc.) in their mouths;
Help your student remember to cough into his/her elbow or forearm, instead of into his/her hand(s), and away from others as much as possible; and
Please consider promoting wellness by staying home as much as possible and especially if you, or your child, may not be feeling well or develops a fever.
We ask that those who have traveled during Spring Break to areas with known COVID-19 cases (both inside and outside the country) please self-report and monitor your symptoms closely. G-PISD employees are asked to notify the Human Resources department via online submission (CLICK HERE to report to HR). Parents/guardians of G-PISD students are asked to provide information to School Nurses as they deem appropriate (CLICK HERE to provide information to School Nurses).
We encourage our families to review information from local and national health officials, including the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) and the San Patricio County Health Department, and stay informed regarding what steps to take if you have recently traveled and/or have determined you may have come in contact with COVID-19.
School Safety & Wellness
In the meantime, G-PISD continues to prepare a learning environment that is as safe as possible for our students and staff with the continuous application of practices that have been in place for several years (and now with increased frequency as a result of concerns related to COVID-19). These efforts include the broad coating of hospital-grade disinfectant on all surfaces in classrooms, hallways, office spaces, and public areas using district-owned and operated electrostatic sprayers. In addition to daily, standard disinfecting procedures performed by teachers and custodial staff, the use of these sprayers provides full-coverage sanitization to sufficiently clean buses, locker rooms, materials, equipment, etc. G-PISD will continue to perform deep cleaning across the District as part of our commitment to safety and wellness.
If you have additional questions, please send an email to Crystal Matern, Communications Officer, at cmatern@g-pisd.org. We will develop a list of questions and answers (FAQs) to be released with the next status update from the District.We will continue do all that we can to prepare for students to return to school, and appreciate your support during this time as we all remain committed to the health and well-being of our students, families, staff, and community.
Thank you,
G-PISD Administration
Haga clic aquí para ver en español.

p.strong: Per the Center for Disease Control, the top three signs of COVID-19 are: fever, cough, and shortness of breath. However, reports and statistics show that those who carry COVID-19 can spread it to others for up to 14 days before they notice any symptoms. This is why it's important to stay home and stay well.

div.p: We hope to receive your continued support as we try to do our part to minimize public interactions and therefore lessen the potential spread of this illness. We also ask that you please consider joining us in following guidelines from medical officials to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 by avoiding large crowds, electing to avoid or limit travel plans, and continuing to follow best practices for preventing illness. Please see the list of reminders below:

ul.li: Practice excellent handwashing procedures, and encourage students to do the same (minimum 20-second scrub with soap all over hands and forearms, every time);
Encourage students to wash hands before every meal, and remind younger students not to place hands (or toys, pencils, etc.) in their mouths;
Help your student remember to cough into his/her elbow or forearm, instead of into his/her hand(s), and away from others as much as possible; and
Please consider promoting wellness by staying home as much as possible and especially if you, or your child, may not be feeling well or develops a fever.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window
